text: is a former Japanese football player. He played for the Japan national team. ==Biography== Omi was born in Tokyo Metropolis on December 26, 1946. After graduating from Hosei University, he joined Hitachi in 1970. In 1972, the club won Japan Soccer League and Emperor's Cup. In 1973, the club won the 2nd place at Japan Soccer League and Emperor's Cup. He retired in 1974. He played 49 games and scored 8 goals in the league. On August 4, 1970, Omi debuted for the Japan national team against Thailand. He also played at 1970 Asian Games.
